RelatedSentence: WASHINGTON â The Environmental Protection Agency introduced standards on Monday aimed at reducing the billions of fish , crabs and shrimp killed by cooling water systems at power plants and factories each year .

The regulations will force more than 1,000 power plants and factories that withdraw at least 2 million gallons of water a day from adjacent waterways for cooling to take steps to minimize its toll on aquatic wildlife .

The regulations will force more than 1,000 power plants and factories that withdraw at least 2 million gallons of water a day from adjacent waterways for cooling to take steps to minimize its toll on aquatic wildlife .
The EPA estimates 2.1 billion fish , crab and shrimp die annually .

âEPA is making it clear that if you have cooling water intakes , you have to look at the impact on aquatic life in local waterways and take steps to minimize that impact , â said Nancy Stoner , the EPA 's acting assistant administrator for water , in a statement .

The rule is among a series issued by the Obama administration targeting air and water pollution from the nation 's power plants , particularly coal - fired facilities .

RelatedSentence: The rule is among a series issued by the Obama administration targeting air and water pollution from the nation 's power plants , particularly coal - fired facilities .
Coal - burning power plants will have limit on mercury and toxic air pollution , and will be the target of a proposal due in June to regulate the gases blamed for global warming for the first time .
